onedcx:simpleDc.dcterms:title: SEDNA: Sea Ice Experiment-Dynamic Nature of the Arctic Data Portal
onedcx:simpleDc.dcterms:subject: sea ice dynamnics
drifting buoys
sea ice properties
Beaufort Sea
Arctic

onedcx:dcTerms.dcterms:abstract: The mass balance of sea ice and evolution of the sea ice thickness distribution is a key component of the Arctic system. It is controlled by thermodynamic ice growth and melt, mechanical redistribution through ridging and rafting, and transport. The SEDNA experiment was designed in a regional Lagrangian frame of reference, and tracked the evolution of a region of ice surrounding the APLIS 2007 ice camp, such that we can isolate the role of mechanical redistribution on the ice thickness distribution.
